data.title: Dinner with the guys while in town
data.text: We could not believe the amount of food you receive for the price. There are so many different types of wings it will make your head spin. The service was good and the food was even better. The sitting is definitely different and hard to seat a large group at this location. We enjoyed our visit. We will come back next time we are in town.

data.title: 30 Years and Still Making Great Food
data.text: Buffalouie's does it right.  Ed and Jamie are always on hand to greet you by name.  The food always great.  Don't come here to have your mind blown by unique creations.  They do wings and burgers.  The salads are good too but stick to what brought you here.  The atmosphere IS college dive-esque and they don't shy away from it.

data.title: A Bloomington institution
data.text: Billed as the site of "The Gables," an old I.U. hangout where Hoagy Carmichael composed, "Stardust," the exterior of the restaurant is the only thing from that era, however, Buffalouie's is full of cool I.U.sports and Hoagy memorabilia. The food is fairly consistent.  Their specialty is wings and one should not stray from the traditional, boned wings.  My son got chicken tenders and they were way overbreaded and overdone.  If you like wings, you'll be in luck.  They have a variety of different sauces, but I never stray from hot or TNT Buffalo.  The last time we were in, it was very crowded, so I'm not going to be too harsh, but tables weren't cleared and bussed and the place was a little messy.

data.title: I challenge you to find better wings.
data.text: Yes I'm a local who has lived in Bloomington for over 20 years. Yes I am biased. But the truth is , there aren't better wings anywhere.  Since Ed and Jamie took over this restaurant , I probably eat here with my kids about once per month , and we have never had a bad experience. The staff is always friendly and accommodating , and the wings just seem to be perfect almost every time. If you are visiting Bloomington and you like wings , don't leave town without visiting. Your taste buds will thank you.

data.title: Always delicious
data.text: Awesome food, great staff! I love the pot roast sandwich, the wings, and the burgers.  A Bloomington must

data.title: Pot roast sandwich, yummo
data.text: We went with a huge party and used up the entire second floor. We didn't expect to place an order at the counter. Chicken tenders were good. Boneless wings were greasy and nothing special. Pot roast sandwich was very good. Grilled chicken Parmesan sandwich was good also. Employees were very helpful.  If we came back it would be for the pot roast sandwich.

data.title: Great wings.. even if you are sitting alone
data.text: I've been here many times, and it is, and always will be a great wings place! Definitely worth trying out the local wing joint

data.title: Hours posted online not accurate
data.text: Their food is normally really good but they were closed 45 minutes before the time they list as their closing time TWICE last week :(

data.title: Best wings in the mid west...
data.text: I've been eating at Buffa Louie's since it was a small time wings and sandwich shop on the bad side of town 30 years ago. They have the best wings in town period. Everything on the menu is worth a trip to Buffa Louie's. Don't bother reading reviews that rate this place "average". There's a reason Buffa Louie's has been around as long as they have in a town where establishments like this come and go. Do yourself a favor....if you're in B-town check out Buffa Louie's.

data.title: Good, not great choice.
data.text: I love wings done right. Unfortunately, although they try to do them right, they were overdone and skimpy in sauce. Other items my family ordered were pretty good. Atmosphere is very cool, and service was great. I'll be back to see if they get those wings right.

data.title: Best wings anywhere
data.text: We love wings, and since moving from Bloomington we have been trying to find good wings. After eating Buffa Louie's, we can't find anything to come close to these delicious wings. Great salads and sides too. Top it off with a Corona and it's perfect. Great atmosphere and location for IU fans. If you are in Bloomington try it. You won't be sorry!

data.title: Love It!
data.text:
Yes, this is your typical college town wing joint - but what's not to love about that?  TONS of sauce choices, tons of wing basket size choices, great drinks, and I love the multi-level seating arrangement.  Hide away in the corner with your better half, or get a huge table with your buddies and chow down on some messy wings.

You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Great wings cold beer
data.text: Typical college wing joint with a nice selection of beer. The mild buffalo had a decent amount of kick and the blue cheese dressing was very good. I had a wheat beer on tap.

data.title: Average
data.text: Nothing special, was there when boneless wings were the daily deal (69cents). Got them volcanic and they were just warm. Had the loaded curly fries as a side and they were pretty darn good, but pricey. Was expecting a full service restaurant and bar but it was an order at the counter type place. Also the layout is odd with lots of steps and different levels, it's a good use of the small footprint but still odd to navigate.

data.title: Great Food!
data.text: I am not the biggest fan of wings but this place has great wings but also awesome other options and runs a lot of fundraisers to help different IU casues.

data.title: Best wings in Bloomington
data.text: Best wings by far - meaty wings with great sauces.  Sure the restaurant itself could have faster service and could be a bit cleaner in the dining areas but these issues are largely the result of being busy do to locale and great good.  Manager is awesome.   One of my favorites - makes it hard to go to BWW ever again.

data.title: Not impressed
data.text:
The rafters and nick knacks are filthy with dust. It is really unpleasant to eat there because of this.
The place was extremely dusty and dirty. We thought moving into the bar area would be nice, it was very dim so we just couldn't see the grime.

data.title: Amazing food
data.text: This quaint little restaurant (none of that is true, it's loud and proud), offers great options.  The menu offers many choices, anything from chicken wings to sausage gravy and biscuits...you won't be disappointed with your choice.  This is a great place to visit if you're a sports nut as well.  There are televisions going all over the place.

data.title: Good little find
data.text: What a great place to eat....we had sandwiches but heard the wings were legendary. The atmosphere is great. The food was pretty good. The price was fair. I personally always look down on "Pepsi" restaurants.... Get COKE!! LOL

data.title: Great Campus Vibe and Friendly Owner
data.text:
Several friends who work at IU recommended Buffa Louie's, so we stopped in for lunch when our daughter was there for a campus visit this spring. It is kind of a quirky place, but the service is efficient and friendly, and the food is yummy. 

The owner/manager was very friendly, stopping by our table to chat and to let our daughter know she was very welcome in Bloomington and at his restaurant. The wings are delicious!
